: Forgetting about it (action a) may not be the best option for Max. If Max assumes the responsibility of fixing the mistakes of others, it may cause him to become frustrated and stressed out. It is important for Max to have a clear understanding of his role and responsibilities on the project.
If Max chooses to confront the others (action b), he should do so in a respectful and professional manner. He should provide a clear explanation of the problem and offer suggestions on how to fix it. If they are not willing to fix the mistakes, Max should escalate the issue to the project manager (action c). It is important for Max to have the support of his manager to address the situation.
If Max chooses to fix the mistakes (action d), he should do so carefully and thoroughly. This may involve taking extra time to review and correct the work of others. By doing so, Max can maintain the high quality of work that he is known for and set a good example for others on the team.<|im_end|>

Max prides himself on his work being of the highest quality. On a joint project, other people do a lousy job, assuming that Max will fix their mistakes. What action would be the most effective for Max? (a) Forget about it; (b) Confront the others, and tell them they must fix their mistakes; (c) Tell the project manager about the situation; (d) Fix the mistakes.
